column4: I'm having some major problems installing Ubuntu 10.04   it won't install Grub2 to the drive... and the kernel module for detecting drives seems to have failed somehow.
are you using raid ?
are you using raid ?
there is a raid on the system, but I'm not trying to install to it... I'm trying to install to a sata drive
are you manually changing the install path for grub using the installer, or later/post install
sorry, I forgot to tag your name in the last reply
dm is a raid device

I just ran the installer in the defacto method, upon reboot, no joy.  Booted back to live cd and tried to install manually to the needed drive, but grub can't see the dev device.  the dm_(something) kernel module isn't loaded
that's a device mapper managed device (normally raid) you said you where not trying to install to raid
whats normally in charge of detecting drives?
no it's not
the devices are /dev/sda, /dev/sdb that sort of thing, /dev/dm are device mappers
you should install to the /dev/sd$X device
I can mount the drives, but when I try to install to /dev/sdb1, it tells me it can't detect the device
that's because /dev/sdb1 is  partition, not a device
you need to install to the disk, not the parttion
I've tried both /dev/sdb and /dev/sdb1
have you mounted your device file system ?
are the device files /dev/sd$X there ?
yeah, the block device files are there in the /dev folder
and when you mount them, does that have the /boot file system on them ?
yep
I just tried installing again... I'll see if I can get it to boot this time.  I may be back in a few.  Wish me luck
